Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2012 01:54PM Love74 wrote: Hikergal - I learned how to pencil in eyebrows at the Look Good Feel Better class.  I haven't had to do that because I ended up getting semi-permanent eyebrow tattoos...which was so worth the money.  I am 6 weeks PFC and still have some eyelashes and eyebrows but they are very thin.  My tattoos make it look like my brows are normal and I just use a little eyeliner to mask the thin eyelashes.  I bought some fake eyelashes but haven't had to use them yet! So I only have a little bit of fuzz starting on my head.  I have been using olive oil at night and nioxin in the morning.  Before chemo my hair grew really fast...hoping it takes off soon!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2012 11:21AM Love74 wrote: Diane - I put a bit of tea tree oil under my nails and also use a cuticle oil with tea tree.  I have also read that soaking them in diluted vinegar helps.  I wear rubber gloves for washing dishes and gardening, etc.  I think my finger nails might survive but I have a few toe nails that are going to come off...I can see new nail growing underneath.

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2013 02:59AM Love74 wrote: wintersocks...I had mine tatood before my second tx one year ago. Its probably the best decision I made! Mine are still thin and fall out occasionally but you would never know unless you were inches from my face looking at them. I had them done before they fell out so they are exactly where my eyebrows are. Expensive but so worth it.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2012 01:10AM Love74 wrote: SelenaWolf - The explanation I got about hair dye from a hairdressor was that when your hair grows back it has the strength of baby hair. The chemicals in the dye could break and damage the hair. And when you dye it the first time make sure its not hi lites or bleaching to a blond colour because that chemical is apparently too strong for six months...I was told that lightening should wait til hair is 1.5". But everybody has different texture hair right? Im sure there are exceptions to the rule...and semi-permanents too.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2011 09:36PM Love74 wrote: Hi mommy23kids and akc, Im going thru the same. Im 36 with 2 lumps...one round and one irregular. The irregular is about 1.8 cms. My results are supposed to be in Monday as well. My core biopsy went well at the time but really bruised and still sore 5 days later. Im having good days and bad days thru this long wait for results. Today is one of those days where i feel extremely sick to my stomach that I might have cancer...that i am going to be the one in five statistic. Such a rollercoaster of emotions. I know if its cancer that i will beat the crap out of it...but not knowing is crazy.
Posts.Title: Saw BS yesterday akc820608 Tenmom

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2011 08:56AM Love74 wrote: akc...the doc tries to freeze you really good before the needle goes in. I kind of jumped a little on the first 'shot'...not because it hurt. I thought if something sounds like that then its gotta hurt! I didnt get any ice on mine until about an hour after which is why i think i have such a giant bruise. Its over pretty quick too.
Posts.Title: Saw BS yesterday akc820608 Tenmom

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2011 12:08AM Love74 wrote: Hi Eileen, I just had my core biopsy yesterday. I have 2 masses quite close together. One is 1.8cm and he other is 5mm. I have a huge bruise over the lumps and the incision is about 2 inches away. I think they do the incision further away so the ultrasound wand can be over top of the mass. I watched the needle go in to the lumps on the screen (5 times in each one) so i am pretty sure that is the reason. Hoping your results are b9...and mine too!
